description: {"blocks":[{"key":"50s84","text":"This SOP defines the completion of International Documentation necessary for the shipment of human islets and biospecimens to investigators outside of the United States for use in the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK) sponsored research in the Integrated Islet Distribution Program (IIDP) using the United Parcel Service (UPS) as a courier. This is SOP is to be used in conjunction with other relevant IIDP SOPs previously published for shipping tissues using Federal Express for shipments within the United guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8jj9k","text":"Responsibilities:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43ind","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo97c","text":"It is the responsibility of the IIDP CC to both follow and ensure adherence to the procedures outlined in this SOP. In order to accomplish this, the IIDP CC will interact with the relevant personnel from each of the participating centers. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dekc6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h85i","text":"It is the responsibility of each IIDP center to follow the procedures listed in this SOP and to work to the best of their ability to follow all requirements.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g8e7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bkrg","text":"Definitions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5f7mi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4202k","text":"Integrated Islet Distribution Program (IIDP) (RRID:SCR_014387): The IIDP is a program commissioned and funded by the NIDDK to provide quality human islets to the diabetes research community to advance scientific discoveries and translational medicine. The IIDP consists of the NIDDK Project Scientist and Program Official, the External Evaluation Committee and the CC at City of Hope (COH). The IIDP CC integrates an interactive group of academic laboratories including the subcontracted IIDP centers.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":37},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":63},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hm6f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgf1g","text":"IIDP Coordinating Center (CC): Joyce Niland, Ph.D.,  and Carmella Evans-Molina, M.D., Ph.D., IIDP Principal Investigators, lead CC staff to coordinate the activities of the IIDP and assist the participating centers and investigators in the distribution of human islets.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eoeiu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ufjh","text":"Islet Equivalent (IEQ):  An IEQ is defined as an islet with a diameter of 150 microns. The number of IEQ in each size class is calculated by multiplying the number of islets by a conversion factor for each micron size.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":23},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52l6s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asgv6","text":"Approved International Investigators: Researchers conducting experiments outside of the United States, who have requested islets from the IIDP for basic science studies and whose research protocols have been reviewed and approved by the IIDP. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":36},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7qdq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ett1s","text":"Islet Allocation System (IA): This is the online system administered by the IIDP to allow fair distribution of basic science islets to approved investigators. This interactive System is used by the IIDP Centers and the Approved Investigators facilitates and tracks the distribution of human islets.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":23},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tuts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"j4cq","text":"Commercial Invoice (CI): The Commercial Invoice is a document provided by Federal Express that must be completed by all centers when shipping islets internationally for the IIDP. It provides the contact information for both the islet provider and the islet recipient. The estimated value of the package should be listed as $10.00 USD. This document should be completed through your Federal Express Account by clicking on Electronic Trade Documents and following the instructions.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":23},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5o28","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccbvq","text":"Certificate of Origin (COO):   A certificate of origin is a document that verifies the manufacturing country of the items being shipped. The item’s origin and destination determine if the certificate is required.  Generally, if the country of origin is the U.S., a certificate will be needed. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er4f0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a71ip","text":"Harmonized Code: The Harmonized Code is a specific group of numbers that informs customs what is contained in the package. In the case of human islet shipments, the code number is 3002.90.5150 which designates human tissue. It is used on the Certificate of Origin document.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dlo1","text":"Stage all materials needed for packaging the islets and ensure all ice packs and CryoPak ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l65d","text":"pouches are at the proper temperature.  The following is a summary of the steps detailed in the following Packaging and Cold Shipping of Human Islets SOP:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fre81","text":"Packaging and Cold Shipping of Human Islets https://www.protocols.io/view/packaging-and-cold-shipping-of-human-islets-ewov18o7ogr2/v2 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":89}],"data":{}},{"key":"6loon","text":"The Cold Chain Complete Card is shipped with the WarmMark Indicator attached. Adhere the ColdMark indicator to the card and activate the WarmMark indicator.                     ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":77}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gh1d","text":"Immediately place the Cold Chain Complete Card along with the islet shipping bottles into a Ziploc bag and seal. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b32dh","text":"Line the inner cardboard (S-4434) box with absorbent pad. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crsba","text":"Place the bagged shipping bottle(s) containing the islets in the Ziploc bag into the lined inner cardboard box.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd071","text":"Surround bottle with six 8ºC cold packs, one on bottom, one on each of the four sides and one on top as directed in the Shipping SOP.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71ncu","text":"Mark the direction for upright bottle. Seal the inner box with shipping tape and stand upright.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qrql","text":"Place one 8°C CryoPak pouch and one 8°C cold pack (stored in the refrigerator) in the bottom of the Styrofoam box.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ea6to","text":"Place the inner cardboard box containing the islets on top of the pouch and pack, ensuring that the bottle inside is standing upright and centered in the shipping container.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpp99","text":"Place one 8°C CryoPak TCP pouch and one -20°C frozen ice pack on each long side of the inner box. (Packs/pouches are placed in the larger gap between the inner box and the insulated shipping container.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nq66","text":"Place one 8°C CryoPak TCP pouch and one 8°C cold pack on the top of the inner box.  NOTE-All packs should be placed in an alternating method, to ensure two of the same packs are not next to each other in the configuration. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":81,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":83,"length":140}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ifod","text":"Place the Styrofoam lid on top. Place Tissue Shipment Form on top of Styrofoam lid.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frrhh","text":"Close the flaps of the shipping box and seal with shipping tape.  Add Live Cells box label to the box.       ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e26eg","text":"Attach FedEx or UPS label with recipient FedEx or UPS number to box and ship priority overnight.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ip7s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0knq","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A40C64329CF811EDB2C00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/packaging-and-cold-shipping-of-human-islets-ewov18o7ogr2/v2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"959pc","text":"The IIDP recommends UPS for most international shipments because UPS is the typical courier outside of the United States. FedEx is not typically used for international shipments but is acceptable for shipping to Canada.   Each center may use whichever shipping vendor is most feasible for them.  These steps follow the UPS website which is a dynamic website.  The FedEx instructions are similar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":395}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0qi7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bvej","text":"Go to the UPS site and log in.
